data.title: Awards and Distinctions
data.meta_description: Her Excellency presented the Member insignia of the Order of Canada to Gilbert Laporte, C.M.. Her Excellency the Right Honourable Julie Payette, Governor General of Canada, invested 3 Companions, 5 Officers and 31 Members into the Order of Canada during a ceremony at Rideau Hall, on November 21, 2019/ Son Excellence présente linsigne de Membre…
data.text:
National orders

Gilbert Laporte is appointed “chevalier de l’Ordre national du Québec” (Knight of the National Order of Quebec), 2023.

Gilbert Laporte is appointed member of the Order of Canada, 2018.

Doctorates honoris causa

Doctorate honoris causa, Molde University College — Specialized University in Logistics, Molde, Norway, 2023.

Doctorate honoris causa, Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU), Trondheim, Norway, 2021.

Doctorate honoris causa, Université de Liège, Belgium, 2018.

Doctorate honoris causa, Eindhoven University of Technology (TUE), the Netherlands, 2016.

Lifetime and career achievement awards

Euro Gold Medal, The Association of European Operational Research Societies, 2022.

Named Professor Emeritus, HEC Montréal, 2021

Killam Prize in Engineering, 2021. See the video in English or in French: https://thefutureeconomy.ca/interviews/applying-mathematics-to-solve-societal-problems/

Marie-Victorin Prize awarded by the Quebec Government to a researcher in engineering or natural sciences, 2018.

Prize of Excellence, Fonds québécois de la recherche sur la nature et les technologies (FRQNT) 2016-2017, ex aequo with Victoria Kaspi, 2017.

Acfas Urgel-Archambault Prize in physical sciences, mathematics, computer science or engineering, 2016.

Lifetime Achievement Award in Location Analysis, Section on Location Analysis, INFORMS, 2014.

Pierre-Laurin Prize for career research achievements, HEC Montréal, ex aequo with Danny Miller, 2012.

Innis-Gérin Medal, Royal Society of Canada, 2007.

Acfas Jacques-Rousseau Prize for Interdisciplinarity, 1999.

Merit Award of the Canadian Operational Research Society, 1994.

Associations

Elected Fellow of the Asia-Pacific Artificial Intelligence Association, 2023.

Gilbert Laporte is named Member Emeritus of the Canadian Operational Research Society, 2020. This status is bestowed upon retired members who have won both the CORS Merit Award and the Service Award.

Gilbert Laporte is named fellow of the EURO Working Group on Vehicle Routing and Logistics Optimization (VeRoLog), 2019.

Inducted as the 42nd Honorary Member of the INFORMS International Omega Rho Society, 2009.

Best papers, books, and presentations

SEIO-BBVA Foundation 2022 Prize for the best applied paper in operations research: Laporte, G., Rancourt, M.-È., Rodríguez-Pereira, J., Silvestri, S., “Optimizing Access to Drinking Water in Remote Areas. Application to Nepal”, Computers & Operations Research, 140, 105669, 2022.

Other honours and mentions

The Optimization Workshop in Logistics (OWL) was organized in Lecce, Italy, to mark the 70th anniversary of Gilbert Laporte, 2023 (postponed from 2020).

In 2023, the Canadian Operational Research Society has created the “Gilbert Laporte Student Paper Award” which recognizes outstanding scientific contributions to the theory, methodology, and practice of operational research in transportation and logistics by an undergraduate, graduate student, or postdoctoral fellow.

According to a bibliometric study (Ioannidis, J.P.A., Bass, J., Klavans, R., Boyack, K.W., “A Standardized Citation Metrics Author Database Annotated for Scientific Field”, PLoS Biology, 17(8): e3000384, 2019, https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pbio.3000384), Gilbert Laporte is the most cited author worldwide in the field of Operations Research, 2019.

Gilbert Laporte is recognized as one of the 50 most famous graduates of the Collège Sainte-Marie over its 121-year history (1848-1969), 2019.

According to a bibliometric study (Laengle, S., Merigó, J.M., Miranda, J., Slowinski, R., Bomze, I., Borgonovo, E., Dyson, R.G., Oliveira, J.F., Teunter, R., “Forty Years of the European Journal of Operational Research”, 262, 803-816, 2017), Gilbert Laporte is the most productive and influential author in the European Journal of Operational Research in its forty year-history, 2017.

According to a bibliometric study (Merigó, J.M., Yang, J.-B., “A Bibliometric Analysis of Operations Research and Management Science”, Omega: The International Journal of Management Science, 71, 37-48, 2016), Gilbert Laporte is the most productive and influential author in Operational Research and Management Science worldwide, 2016.

Gilbert Laporte is Canada’s third most influential researcher in the field of business, according to HiBAR, the Hirsch-Index Benchmarking of Academic Research, 2012.

The Network Optimization Workshop 2010 was organized in Ajaccio, France, to mark the 60th anniversary of Gilbert Laporte, 2010.

According to a bibliometric study (Hsieh, P.-N., Chang, P.-L, “An Assessment of World-Wide Research Productivity in Production and Operations Management”, International Journal of Production Economics 120, 540-551, 2009), Gilbert Laporte is the most prolific author in five top journals of his field, he has the highest h-index among 44,881 authors surveyed, and he comes third for the number of publications in 20 journals for the period 1959-2008, 2009.

Discrete Applied Mathematics has published a special issue (vol. 145, 2004) containing some of the papers presented at the Fourth Colloquium on Graphs and Optimization (GO-IV) that took place at Loèche-les-Bains, Switzerland, from August 20 to 24, 2000. This event was organized to mark Gilbert Laporte’s 50th birthday, 2004.

Invited as the Tow Lecturer, Henry B. Tippie College of Business, University of Iowa, 2005.

The GO IV Conference (Graphs and Optimization) was organized in my honour, Loèche-les-Bains, Switzerland, 2000
